TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DesignerAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies the class used to implement design-time services for a component.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The class you use for the design-time services must implement the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner> interface.
Use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute.DesignerBaseTypeName%2A> property to find the designer's base type. Use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute.DesignerTypeName%2A> property to get the name of the type of designer associated with this member.
For more information, see [Attributes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/30386922-1e00-4602-9ebf-526b271a8b87).
## Examples The following example creates a class called `MyForm`. `MyForm` has two attributes, a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> that specifies this class uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.DocumentDesigner>, and a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerCategoryAttribute> that specifies the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerCategoryAttribute.Form> category.
[!code-cpp[Classic DesignerAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DesignerAttribute Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic DesignerAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DesignerAttribute Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic DesignerAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DesignerAttribute Example/VB/source.vb#1)]
The next example creates an instance of `MyForm`. Then it gets the attributes for the class, extracts the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute>, and prints the name of the designer.
[!code-cpp[Classic DesignerAttribute Example#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DesignerAttribute Example/CPP/source.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[Classic DesignerAttribute Example#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DesignerAttribute Example/CS/source.cs#2)] [!code-vb[Classic DesignerAttribute Example#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DesignerAttribute Example/VB/source.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string designerTypeName) cil managed

Docs.param: The concatenation of the fully qualified name of the type that provides design-time services for the component this attribute is bound to, and the name of the assembly this type resides in.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the name of the type that provides design-time services.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The class you use for the design-time services must implement the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner> interface.

Docs.param: A that represents the class that provides design-time services for the component this attribute is bound to.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the type that provides design-time services.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The class you use for the design-time services must implement the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string designerTypeName, string designerBaseTypeName) cil managed

Docs.param: The concatenation of the fully qualified name of the type that provides design-time services for the component this attribute is bound to, and the name of the assembly this type resides in.
The fully qualified name of the base class to associate with the designer class.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the designer type and the base class for the designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The class you use for the design-time services must implement the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner> interface.
The `designerBaseTypeName` parameter allows you to attach more than one type of designer for a given class.

Docs.param: The concatenation of the fully qualified name of the type that provides design-time services for the component this attribute is bound to, and the name of the assembly this type resides in.
A that represents the base class to associate with the designerTypeName.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, using the name of the designer class and the base class for the designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The class you use for the design-time services must implement the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner> interface.
The `designerBaseType` parameter allows you to attach more than one type of designer for a given class.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the types of the designer and designer base class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The class you use for the design-time services must implement the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner> interface.
The `designerBaseType` parameter allows you to attach more than one type of designer for a given class.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the base type of this designer.
Docs.value: The name of the base type of this designer.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the designer type associated with this designer attribute.
Docs.value: The name of the designer type associated with this designer attribute.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
Gets a unique ID for this attribute type.
Docs.value: A unique ID for this attribute type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks It is used by filtering algorithms to identify two attributes that are the same type. For most attributes, this just returns the <xref:System.Type> instance for the attribute. <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> overrides this to include the type of the designer base type.
